alert.note: Alert for Boone; Dallas; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Polk; Story; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 2:18AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with Heavy Rain May Cause Localized Flooding across portions of Polk, southwestern Story, northeastern Madison, northwestern Marion, western Jasper, southeastern Boone, eastern Dallas and northern Warren Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving into the Des Moines metro area. These storms will be possible of producing 2 or more inches of rain in a short period of time. Additional rainfall is possible as additional storms develop. HAZARD...Additional heavy rainfall of one to two inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Johnston and Saylorville Lake around 220 AM CDT. Polk City, Saylorville and Big Creek Lake around 225 AM CDT. Slater around 230 AM CDT. Huxley around 235 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 65 and 72, and between mile markers 87 and 112. Interstate 80 between mile markers 109 and 153. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and south central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Dallas; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Polk; Story; Warren
